TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant was engaged in emergency operations at the site of the GPE nuclear plant disaster . She was issued with a certificate confirming her participation in the emergency operations . As a holder of the certificate she was entitled to certain DATE payments .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE ORG of LOC of GPE ( ORG социальной защиты населения Октябрьского района г. PERSON , hereinafter “ the social security service ” ) paid to the applicant the arrears for the period from DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE held that the social security service had unlawfully defaulted on the DATE payments from DATE . The judgment was not appealed against and became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the social security service discontinued the payments . The applicant sued the social security service .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE held that the social security service had unlawfully refused to pay . The applicant held a certificate confirming her participation in the emergency operations in GPE and was entitled to receive the payments . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment on appeal and it became enforceable .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted the writ of execution to the bailiffs .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiffs opened enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant received MONEY ( RUB ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiffs directed that the social security service pay the judgment debt by DATE . The social security service did not comply .
CARDINAL . The judgment remains unenforced in part . According to the Government , the debt amounts to RUB CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE Judge PERSON , the President of ORG , lodged an application for supervisory review of the judgments of CARDINAL DATE and DATE , as upheld on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG chaired by Judge PERSON quashed the judgments of CARDINAL DATE and DATE , as upheld on DATE , and remitted the cases for a fresh examination before ORG . It found that ORG had erred in the assessment of the facts and application of domestic law . In particular , it had not verified whether the certificate confirming the applicant 's participation in emergency operations at the site of the GPE nuclear plant disaster was valid .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held that the discontinuation of the DATE payments had been lawful and dismissed the applicant 's claims . It found that the certificate confirming the applicant 's participation in the emergency operations at the site of the GPE nuclear plant disaster had been issued by an unauthorised person and was void . Consequently the applicant was not entitled to DATE payments .
